step.title: Transporting batteries in equipment by land

paragraph.htmltext:
Cells transported in equipment

LITHIUM ION CELLS CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT - Fully regulated cells

Applies to: Lithium ion cells contained in equipment with a Watt-hour rating in excess of 20 Wh/cell

Un No., Proper shipping name: UN 3481, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT

Class: 9

Packing group: II

Hazard Label:

  • Labels must be in the form of a square set at an angle of 50° (diamond-shaped) with minimum dimensions of 100 mm by 100 mm.
  • They must have a line 5 mm inside the edge and running parallel with it.

Prerequisite: Cells must meet the General Requirements of flow Transportation in particular the test requirements.

Specific Requirements:

  • Each cell incorporates a safety venting device or is designed to preclude a violent rupture under normal conditions of carriage.
  • Each cell is equipped with an effective means of preventing external short circuits.
  • Equipment must be equipped with an effective means of preventing accidental activation.

Transport mode: ADR P903

Packaging instructions: Cells must be protected against short circuit, including protection against contact with conductive materials within the same packaging that could lead to a short circuit. Equipment containing cells must be packed in strong outer packagings. The equipment containing the cells must be secured against movement within the outer packaging and be packed so as to prevent accidental operation during transport;

Packaging: Packaging tests not necessary

Weight limit lithium batteries per piece of equipment: No limit

Tunnel code: (E)

Transport cat.: 2

Exemptions: chapter 1.1.3.6 – limit ≤333 kg Net

Marking and Handling Labels on Packages: UN 3481

Overpack: “Overpack”

Documents: Transport document

Practical example of packaging, marking and labelling of packages containing lithium ion cells fully regulated installed in equipment: Li-ion Wh rating 30 Wh/cell – Net weight 15 kg

LITHIUM ION CELLS CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT – Small cells exempted

Applies to: Lithium ion cells contained in equipment with a Watt-hour rating not exceeding 20 Wh/cell

Un No., Proper shipping name: UN 3480, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT

Class: 9

Packing group: II

Hazard Label: Not required

Prerequisite: Cells must meet the General Requirements of flow Transportation in particular the test requirements.

Exemption conditions: SP 188

  • Cells when installed in equipment must be protected from damage and short circuit, must be secured against movement within the outer packaging.
  • The equipment must be equipped with an effective means of preventing accidental activation.
  • Devices such as radio frequent identification (RFID) tags, watches and temperature loggers, which are not capable of generating a dangerous evolution of heat, may be transported when intentionally active.

Packaging: The equipment must be packed in strong outer packagings constructed of suitable material of adequate strength and design in relation to the packaging's capacity and its intended use unless the cell is afforded equivalent protection by the equipment in which it is contained.

Weight limit batteries/package: No limit

Marking and Handling Labels on Packages:

  • an indication that the package contains "lithium ion cells”
  • an indication that the package shall be handled with care and that a flammability hazard exists if the package is damaged;
  • an indication that special procedures shall be followed in the event the package is damaged, to include. Inspection and repacking if necessary;
  • a telephone number for additional information;

Marking is not required for packages containing:

  • Button cell installed in equipment (including circuit boards),
  • ≤ 4 cells installed in equipment

Overpack: “Overpack”

Documents: Transport document is not required

Each consignment must be accompanied with a document with an indication that:

  • The package contains lithium ion cells;
  • The package must be handled with care and that a flammability hazard exists if the package is damaged;
  • Special procedures must be followed in the event the package is damaged, to include inspection and repacking if necessary; and
  • A telephone number for additional information.

Instruction to personnel: Any person preparing or offering cells for transport must receive adequate instruction on these requirements commensurate with their responsibilities.

Practical example of packaging, marking and labelling of packages containing small exempted lithium ion cells installed in equipment: Li-ion Wh rating 5 Wh/cell – Net weight 3 kg.

Modules and Packs transported in equipment

LITHIUM ION BATTERIES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT – Fully regulated batteries

Applies to: Lithium ion batteries contained in equipment with a Watt-hour rating in excess of 100 Wh/battery

Un No., Proper shipping name: UN 3481, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT

Class: 9

Packing group: II

Hazard Label:

  • Labels must be in the form of a square set at an angle of 50° (diamond-shaped) with minimum dimensions of 100 mm by 100 mm.
  • They must have a line 5 mm inside the edge and running parallel with it.

Prerequisite: Batteries must meet the General Requirements of flow Transportation in particular the test requirements.

Specific Requirements:

  • Each battery incorporates a safety venting device or is designed to preclude a violent rupture under normal conditions of carriage.
  • Each battery is equipped with an effective means of preventing external short circuits.
  • Equipment must be equipped with an effective means of preventing accidental activation.
  • Each battery containing cells or series of cells connected in parallel must be equipped with an effective means as necessary, to prevent dangerous reverse current flow (e.g. diodes, fuses).
  • Batteries manufactured after 31 December 2011 must be marked with the Wh rating in the outside case

Transport mode: ADR P903

Packaging instructions: Batteries must be protected against short circuit, including protection against contact with conductive materials within the same packaging that could lead to a short circuit. Equipment containing batteries must be packed in strong outer packagings. The equipment containing the batteries must be secured against movement within the outer packaging and be packed so as to prevent accidental operation during transport;

Packaging: Packaging tests not necessary

Weight limit lithium batteries per piece of equipment: No limit

Tunnel code: (E)

Transport cat.: 2

Exemptions: chapter 1.1.3.6 – limit ≤333 kg Net

Marking and Handling Labels on Packages: UN 3481

Overpack: “Overpack”

Documents: Transport document

Practical example of packaging, marking and labelling of packages containing lithium ion cells fully regulated installed in equipment: Li-ion Wh rating 120 Wh/cell – Net weight 15 kg

LITHIUM ION BATTERIES PACKED WITH EQUIPMENT – Fully regulated batteries

Applies to: Lithium ion batteries contained in equipment with a Watt-hour rating not exceeding 100 Wh/battery

Un No., Proper shipping name: UN 3481, LITHIUM ION BATTERIES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT

Class: 9

Packing group: II

Hazard Label: Not required

Prerequisite: Batteries must meet the General Requirements of flow Transportation in particular the test requirements.

Specific Requirements:

  • The Watt-hour rating must be marked on the outside of the battery case except those manufactured before 1 January 2009

Transport mode: ADR

Exempt conditions: SP 188

  • Batteries when installed in equipment must be protected from damage and short circuit, must be secured against movement within the outer packaging.
  • The equipment must be equipped with an effective means of preventing accidental activation.
  • Devices such as radio frequent identification (RFID) tags, watches and temperature loggers, which are not capable of generating a dangerous evolution of heat, may be transported when intentionally active.

Packaging: The equipment must be packed in strong outer packagings constructed of suitable material of adequate strength and design in relation to the packaging's capacity and its intended use unless the cell is afforded equivalent protection by the equipment in which it is contained.

Weight limit: 30 kg Gross

Marking and Handling Labels on Packages:

  • an indication that the package contains "lithium ion batteries”
  • an indication that the package shall be handled with care and that a flammability hazard exists if the package is damaged;
  • an indication that special procedures shall be followed in the event the package is damaged, to include Inspection and repacking if necessary;
  • a telephone number for additional information;

Marking is not required for packages containing:

  • Button cell installed in equipment (including circuit boards),
  • ≤ 2 batteries installed in equipment

Overpack: “Overpack”

Documents: Transport document is not required

Each consignment must be accompanied with a document with an indication that:

  • The package contains lithium ion cells;
  • The package must be handled with care and that a flammability hazard exists if the package is damaged;
  • Special procedures must be followed in the event the package is damaged, to include inspection and repacking if necessary; and
  • A telephone number for additional information.

Instructions to personnel: Any person preparing or offering batteries for transport must receive adequate instructions on these requirements commensurate with their responsibilities.

Practical example of packaging, marking and labelling of packages containing lithium ion batteries partially exempted: Li-ion Wh rating 40 Wh/cell – N. Batteries/package > 2 – Gross weight 8 kg
